intro: Alfaroa costaricensis subsp. costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican alfaroa, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
